Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant met the requirements of s. 4 of the Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
Governing_Law: Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations, s. 4
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant missed the 30-day deadline after patent grant; supplemental submission for name change was not a qualifying event
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant to demonstrate compliance with regulatory requirements
Legal_Rule: Section 4 imposes strict timing requirements for adding patents to the register based on grant date and new drug submission
Procedural_Issue: Failure to meet statutory deadline for patent listing
Grounds_for_Claim: Challenge to Minister's refusal to include patent on the register
Review_Standard: Standard of reasonableness applied to administrative decision
Key_Evidence_Considered: Date of patent grant, timing of submission, nature of supplemental filing
Legal_Framework: Federal Court Act, Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
Applicant_Challenge: Minister incorrectly excluded the '133 patent from the register
Defendant_Response: Submission was out of time and did not qualify under any allowable category
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of patent grant and submission dates
Remedy_Requested: Inclusion of patent on the register
Legal_Provision: s. 4 of the Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
Legal_Provision_Cited: s. 4 of the Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to comply with statutory deadline
Applicable_Process: Notice of Compliance regulations and patent listing procedure
Governing_Rule: s. 4 of the Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
